alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Chesterfield; Powhatan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 9:53PM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River Above Farmville affecting Cumberland, Prince Edward and Amelia Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Appomattox River At Mattoax affecting Powhatan, Chesterfield and Amelia Counties. For the Appomattox Basin...including Farmville, Mattoax, Matoaca... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Appomattox River at Mattoax. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Agricultural and some secondary roads flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 21.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EST Wednesday was 21.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.7 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.8 feet on 05/23/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1000 AM EST.
